title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Reverting a file is significantly slower than closing and reopening it in the Java editor.
OB: I observed that when I answered 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and then double-clicked on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file properly reopened. However, when I repeated the same steps and selected 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it took approximately 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original contents.
EB: When I select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, I expect the contents of the window to be replaced with the original contents instantly, or at least within a reasonable timeframe.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Make changes to the file.
3. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
4. Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Observe that the file reopens quickly.
6. Repeat steps 1-4.
7. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
8. Observe that it takes approximately 15 seconds for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original contents.
